movies.title: Never Back Losers
movies.plot: Two rival gangs are trying to fix horse races and a jockey is attacked and left for dead in a stage-managed car crash. An insurance investigator makes routine inquires into the "accident" and one of the gang leaders feels threatened by this and takes counter measures.
movies.simplePlot: Two rival gangs are trying to fix horse races and a jockey is attacked and left for dead in a stage-managed car crash. An insurance investigator makes routine inquires into the "accident" ...

biography.bio: Hilda Barry was born on June 9, 1884 in Edmonton, London, England as Hilda Mary Gentle. She was an actress, known for Poor Cow (1967), The Confessional (1976) and Cent millions ont disparu (1964). She died on May 29, 1979 in Islington, London.
biography.name: Hilda Barry

biography.bio: Douglas Bradley-Smith was born on September 5, 1902 in Hendon, Middlesex, England as Percy Douglas Smith. He was an actor, known for Dr. Crippen (1963), Take Me Over (1963) and The Sword and the Rose (1953). He died on January 28, 1963 in Haslemere, Surrey, England.
biography.name: Douglas Bradley-Smith

biography.bio: Jacqueline Ellis was born on June 21, 1934 as Jacqueline Sheelagh Ellis. She is an actress, known for Gutter Girls (1963), The Problem of Mary Winshaw (1962) and The Hi-Jackers (1963). She is married to Brian Heard. She was previously married to Griffith Davies and Jeffrey Bernard.
biography.name: Jacqueline Ellis

biography.bio: Tenniel Evans briefly attended the British Army officer training centre Sandhurst (1945-1946). He studied German and economics at St. Andrews University (1946-1949). He attended the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art (1949-1951) and acted on stage from 1951, although he also had an in-between job as a private school teacher near Northampton. His regular stage work included West End performances as well as the Royal Court Theatre Company, Savoy Theatre and Globe Theatre. He was part of the cast of the hugely popular 1960s radio comedy "The Navy Lark". He appeared in television from 1960. Evans is fondly remembered by cult television fans as Major Daly, acting opposite his friend Jon Pertwee, in Doctor Who: Carnival of Monsters: Episode One (1973) and as Kevin's (Michael Palin's) puritanical father in Ripping Yarns: The Curse of the Claw (1977).
biography.name: Tenniel Evans

biography.bio: Derek Francis was born on November 7, 1923 in Brighton, East Sussex, England. He was an actor, known for Scrooge (1970), The Tomb of Ligeia (1964) and Jabberwocky (1977). He was married to Penelope Elsden Smith. He died on March 27, 1984 in Wimbledon, London, England.
biography.name: Derek Francis

biography.bio: Harold Goodwin was born on October 22, 1917 in Wombwell, Barnsley, Yorkshire, England. He was an actor, known for The Bridge on the River Kwai (1957), The Prince and the Showgirl (1957) and The Man in the White Suit (1951). He died on June 3, 2004 in Middlesex, England.
biography.name: Harold Goodwin

biography.bio: Jack Hedley was born on October 28, 1930 in London, England as Jack Hawkins. He is an actor, known for For Your Eyes Only (1981), L'éventreur de New York (1982) and The World of Tim Frazer (1960).
biography.name: Jack Hedley

biography.bio: Harry Locke was born on December 10, 1913 in London, England. He was an actor, known for All at Sea (1957), The L-Shaped Room (1962) and Treasure Island (1950). He died on September 7, 1987 in London.
biography.name: Harry Locke

biography.bio: Born in Armagh, Northern Ireland, Patrick Magee is a classic example of how certain actors rate the stage far more highly than the screen. Magee was well aware that the vast majority of the films that he appeared in were dreadful (he mostly played sinister villains in horror films), but the money came in very handy in financing his distinguished stage work (he was a favorite actor of Samuel Beckett one of whose greatest plays, 'Krapp's Last Tape', was written specifically for him). However, he did do some outstanding work on film, most notably in Stanley Kubrick's A Clockwork Orange (1971) as the crippled writer Mr.Alexander, and in Kubrick's Barry Lyndon (1975), as the chevalier. He also appeared in Joseph Losey's The Servant (1963), Peter Brook's Marat/Sade (1967) and William Friedkin's The Birthday Party (1968). He also appeared in films by such cult directors as Roger Corman, Lucio Fulci and Walerian Borowczyk.
biography.name: Patrick Magee

biography.bio: Larry Martyn was born on March 22, 1934 in London, England as Lawrence Martyn. He was an actor, known for Spring and Autumn (1972), The Final Conflict (1981) and Are You Being Served? (1972). He died on August 7, 1994 in Kent, England.
biography.name: Larry Martyn

biography.bio: Howard Pays was an English actor who gave up acting for representing thespians and other professionals in television and motion pictures, becoming one of England's most successful talent agents in the process. After being demobilized from the military after serving his National Service commitment, Pays became an actor. He made his television debut in the popular series Sixpenny Corner (1955) in 1955 where he met, and married, his co-star, Jan Miller. In the early 1960s, Pays quit acting and opened the talent agency "CCA" in London. He and his partner, Freddie Vale, turned the agency into one of the most important in the U.K. and the English-speaking world. He was still a top agent at the time of his death, from cancer, in April 2002. He was 74 years old.
biography.name: Howard Pays

biography.bio: Larry Taylor was born on July 13, 1918 in Peterborough, England. He is known for his work on Chitty Chitty Bang Bang (1968), Zulu (1964) and Swiss Family Robinson (1960). He died on August 6, 2003 in Johannesburg, South Africa.
biography.name: Larry Taylor

biography.bio: George Tovey was born on March 8, 1914 in Kensington, London, England as George William Tovey. He was an actor, known for Frenzy (1972), Steptoe and Son Ride Again (1973) and Potts and the Phantom Piper (1957). He was married to Margaret (Peggy) Tovey. He died in 1982 in Hounslow, London.
biography.name: George Tovey

biography.bio: Austin Trevor was born on October 8, 1897 in Belfast, Ireland as Claude Austin Trevor Schilsky. He was an actor, known for The Red Shoes (1948), Goodbye, Mr. Chips (1939) and The Day the Earth Caught Fire (1961). He was married to Violet Clowes. He died on January 21, 1978 in Bury St. Edmunds, Suffolk, England.
biography.name: Austin Trevor

biography.bio: Richard Warner was born on May 24, 1911 in Congerstone, Leicester, Leicestershire, England. He was an actor, known for Crown Court (1972), Village of the Damned (1960) and Tom Grattan's War (1968). He died on January 14, 1989 in Kent, England.
biography.name: Richard Warner
